summary: U.S. service academy graduates are expected to lead as military officers. The academies use honor and conduct systems to enforce ethical and moral standards among students. Each academy offers due process protections so that students accused of an offense receive a fair hearing. But the guidance at some academies doesn't clearly specify certain protections. title: Service Academies: Clarifying Guidance Would Enhance Effectiveness of Honor and Conduct Systems
